Class LevelThree

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.levels.LevelParent
com.example.demo.levels.LevelThree
public class LevelThree extends LevelParent
Represents the third level in the game. This level introduces a challenging boss enemy (BossTwo) and features power-ups and heart items to enhance the gameplay. The level ends when the boss is defeated or the player is destroyed. It extends the LevelParent class to inherit common game-level functionalities.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelThree

      public LevelThree(double screenHeight, double screenWidth, Controller controller)
      Constructs the third level with the specified screen dimensions and controller.
      Parameters:
      screenHeight - the height of the game screen.
      screenWidth - the width of the game screen.
      controller - the game controller responsible for managing game interactions.

  • Method Details

    • initializeFriendlyUnits

      protected void initializeFriendlyUnits()
      Initializes the friendly units for this level. Adds the player-controlled character to the game root, making it visible and active.
      Specified by:
      initializeFriendlyUnits in class LevelParent

    • checkIfGameOver

      protected void checkIfGameOver()
      Checks the conditions for game-over scenarios. If the player-controlled character is destroyed, the game is lost. If the boss is destroyed, the player wins the level.
      Specified by:
      checkIfGameOver in class LevelParent

    • animateBossTwoEntry

      private void animateBossTwoEntry()
      Animates the boss's entry into the level. The boss moves from off-screen on the right to its starting position within the game area.

    • spawnEnemyUnits

      protected void spawnEnemyUnits()
      Spawns enemy units for this level. Ensures the boss enemy is added to the game root and initializes its entry animation. Periodically spawns power-ups and heart items.
      Specified by:
      spawnEnemyUnits in class LevelParent

    • spawnPowerUps

      private void spawnPowerUps()
      Spawns power-ups and heart items at random intervals based on their respective probabilities. - Power-ups enhance the player's abilities temporarily. - Heart items restore health to the player.

    • addPowerUp

      private void addPowerUp(Actor powerUp)
      Adds a power-up to the game and makes it visible on the screen.
      Parameters:
      powerUp - the power-up actor to be added.

    • NewHeartDisplay

      protected HeartDisplay NewHeartDisplay(javafx.scene.Group root, double xPosition, double yPosition, int heartsToDisplay)
      Creates a new HeartDisplay for this level with a fixed number of hearts.
      Overrides:
      NewHeartDisplay in class LevelParent
      Parameters:
      root - the root group to which the HeartDisplay belongs.
      xPosition - the x-coordinate for the HeartDisplay.
      yPosition - the y-coordinate for the HeartDisplay.
      heartsToDisplay - the number of hearts to display.
      Returns:
      a new HeartDisplay instance.

    • getObjectiveText

      protected String getObjectiveText()
      Provides the objective text for this level.
      Specified by:
      getObjectiveText in class LevelParent

      the objective text for this level.
